questionTitle: Which of the following was one of the top 5 cloud applications in 2010?
questionExplanation: Cloud computing has shifted the economics of software delivery in a manner similar to the way that music downloads have shifted the delivery of commercial music.

questionOption1: Google’s cloud includes perhaps some 10 data centers worldwide
questionOption2: Flipkart.com’s infrastructure was built to support elastic demand so the system could accommodate peak traffic
questionOption3: Data centers have been sited to optimize the overall system latency
questionExplanation: Datacenter can Keep land costs modest and occupation unobtrusive.

questionTitle: Which of the following benefit is related to creates resources that are pooled together in a system that supports multi-tenant usage?
questionExplanation: A cloud service provider creates resources that are pooled together in a system that supports multi-tenant usage.

questionTitle: The _____ is something that you can obtain under contract from your vendor.
questionExplanation: Depending upon the type of service being offered, you may find that you do not require hardware or software licenses to implement your service.

questionOption1: Internet consumes roughly 1 percent of the world’s total power
questionOption2: The cost advantages of cloud computing have enabled new software vendors to create productivity applications
questionOption3: A client can provision computer resources without the need for interaction with cloud service provider personnel
questionExplanation: Data centers have been sited to have access to low cost power.

questionTitle: All cloud computing applications suffer from the inherent _______ that is intrinsic in their WAN connectivity.
questionExplanation: While cloud computing applications excel at large-scale processing tasks, if your application needs large amounts of data transfer, cloud computing may not be the best model for you.

questionTitle: Cloud computing is a _______ system and it is necessarily unidirectional in nature.
questionExplanation: Cloud computing is a stateless system, as is the Internet in general.

questionTitle: Which of the following is the most important area of concern in cloud computing?
questionExplanation: When your data travels over and rests on systems that are no longer under your control, you have increased risk due to the interception and malfeasance of others.

questionTitle: You can’t count on a cloud provider maintaining your _____ in the face of government actions.
questionExplanation: Cloud computing industry continues to address security concerns.

questionTitle: Which of the following architectural standards is working with cloud computing industry?
questionExplanation: These standards help to enable different business models that cloud computing vendors can support, most notably Software as a Service (SaaS), Web 2.0 applications, and utility computing.
